title: Who Let The Dogs In? We Did, About 30,000 Years Ago
description: A new study suggests that canis familiaris split from wolves much earlier than the 11,000 to 16,000 years ago that was long assumed.

title: West Philadelphia Orchestra On World Cafe
description: A group that specializes in Balkan music talks about how they grew as a band.

title: Pop Culture Happy Hour: For 'Mad Men' And Letterman, A Week Of Goodbyes
description: Mad Men just ended after seven seasons; David Letterman is done with late-night TV after 33. The gang discusses both farewells, both legacies, and What's Making Us Happy this week.

title: The Brave New World Of 'Editing' Human Genes
description: A new gene technology is so powerful, it’s sparking debate about whether humankind should tinker with its own gene pool.

title: 'All Souls Trilogy' Author Deborah Harkness
description: The hugely successful books are set in a world where witches, vampires and demons live alongside humans.

title: 2015 Shaping Up To Be An El Niño Year
description: Mike Halpert, deputy director of NOAA's Climate Prediction Center, explains what this may mean for the weather.

title: #NPRReads: Social Concern And The Drought In California
description: Also this week, a profile of plus-sized model Tess Holliday, algorithms in plain(ish) English, and suicide clusters in Palo Alto, Calif.

title: The Ad That Ushered In An Era Of Tough-On-Crime Politics
description: In 1988, an attack ad about Gov. Michael Dukakis granting "weekend prison passes" to murderers upended the presidential race.

title: What's Next For Colorado's Controversial Birth Control Program?
description: The state legislature has voted against continuing a program that's credited with reducing teen pregnancies and abortions.

title: Irish Voters Decide Whether To Legalize Same-Sex Marriage
description: The referendum is expected to pass with more than two-thirds support, 22 years after homosexuality was decriminalized.

title: State Department Releases Clinton Emails
description: The department released the first batch of 296 emails from the former secretary of state's email accounts, which were provided to the Select Committee on Benghazi in February.

title: A Desk That Can Take A Ton Of Earthquake Rubble
description: It's fairly light, costs $35 per student and could save lives in earthquake zones. But not everyone thinks this quake-proof desk is a good idea.

title: The Recipients
description: Cynthia McCabe was checking her email one last time before she went to bed when a strange message caught her attention. "I'm an American expat writer," it said. "And this is my last day on Earth."

title: The Red Lantern
description: What is it that drives a man across the middle of the frozen tundra? Jeff Greenwald performs live at The Monkey House Theater in Berkeley, Calif., for the event, "That Really Happened???"

title: Shot in the Dark
description: Growing up, David Jackson knew one thing for sure: He would never be like his dad.
